intro: Boerhavia insularis, commonly known as the island blite, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, fleshy leaves and pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of botanical interest. Boerhavia insularis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat.
